header.title: Hibernate EMF Resources
header.notice: Describes the use of an EMF resource implemenation for Hibernate
header.abstract: The EMF Hibernate integration also contains a Resource implementation for integration with the EMF Editing Domain. The resource implementation extends the org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMIResourceImpl to enable easy importing and exporting of XML to/from the relational store.

section.title: Resource URI
section.p: The Hibernate EMFResource is registered using different extensions/protocols:

ul.li: Protocol: the Hibernate EMF Resource (factory) will be registered for the protocols hibernate and ehb
Extension: the Hibernate EMF Resource (factory) will be registered for the extensions hibernate and ehb

section.p: When the hibernate protocol is used to retrieve a Resource then the resource needs to know how to reach a data store. This is done by passing the registration name of a HbDataStore to the resource with the org.eclipse.emf.teneo.Resource.DS_NAME_PARAM parameter.
An example of a URI which returns a Hibernate resource: hibernate://dsname=library.

section.title: Hibernate Resource and session/transaction specifics
section.p: The Hibernate Resource opens a session when it is loaded for the first time. A transaction is started when the load starts and committed at the end of the load. This session is disconnected at the end of the load action.
The save action will reconnect the session, begin a transaction, do an update of the datastore and then commit and disconnect.
In one of the next releases a new resource implementation will be added which will create a new session for each load and save action.

section.title: Validation
section.p: The Hibernate Resource automatically validates its content (the EObjects) when the resource is saved. This validation makes use of the EMF validation framework throug calls to the Diagnostician.INSTANCE.validate method. Validation fails when a ERROR level Diagnostic is encountered. In this case the resource save method will throw a org.eclipse.emf.teneo.StoreValidationException. This exception has a method to retrieve all Diagnostics.

section.title: Standard load behavior: Top level types
section.p: When a Hibernate EMF resource is loaded then only the so called top-level types are directly present in the resource contents. Top-level types are types which are not used as the the child in a containment relation. The assumption is that all contained types can be reached from a top-level type.

section.title: Customizing load behavior
section.p: It is possible to customize what the resource actually loads from the database.

section.title: Extend the resource implementation in java
section.p: It is possible to customize the load behavior by overriding the loadFromStore method in the HibernateResource. This method gets a PersistenceManager and should return a list of objects read from the Hibernate datastore.

section.title: Set specific queries to load the resource
section.p: There are two ways to pass specific queries to the HibernateResource. The first method is using uri parameters:
You can pass multiple queries by using parameter names which start with query, for example query1, query2 etc.
The other way to pass queries to the resource are to specify them in the .ehb file (see resource utility here). An example (commented out) of this can be found in the ehb file here.

section.title: Resource use after Hibernate exception
section.p: When a Hibernate error/exception occurs when working with a Hibernate resource it can not be used anymore and should be unloaded (closed).
In a future resource implementation this issue will be solved.

section.title: Closing a resource
section.p: The Hibernate EMF resource can be closed by calling the unload method. This method will close the disconnected session.
